001 
002import java.util.HashMap;
003/**
004 * This class is part of the "World of Zuul" application. 
005 * "World of Zuul" is a very simple, text based adventure game.  
006 * 
007 * This class holds an enumeration table of all command words known to the game.
008 * It is used to recognise commands as they are typed in.
009 *
010 * @author  Michael Kolling and David J. Barnes + D.Bureau
011 * @version 2008.03.30 + 2019.09.25
012 */
013public class CommandWords
014{
015    // a constant array that will hold all valid command words
016    private final HashMap<String, CommandWord> aValidCommands;
017  
018    /**
019 * Constructor - initializes the list of valid command words.
020 */
021    public CommandWords()
022    {
023        this.aValidCommands = new HashMap<>();
024       for (CommandWord command : CommandWord.values() ) {
025           this.aValidCommands.put(command.getDescription(), command);
026       }
027    } // CommandWords()
028
029    
030    public CommandWord getCommandWord(final String pCommandString) {
031        return this.aValidCommands.get(pCommandString);
032        
033    }
034    
035    /**
036 * Returns a list of all valid command words.
037 * 
038 * @return A string containing all valid commands separated by a space.
039 */
040
041    public String getCommandList() {
042        StringBuilder vCommandList = new StringBuilder("");
043        for (String command : this.aValidCommands.keySet())
044            vCommandList.append(command).append(" ");
045        return vCommandList.toString();
046    } //getCommandList
047} // CommandWords
